title: 1T‾×1N‾\overline{1T} \times \overline{1N}1T×1N

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If we write out the 10s and 100s columns in the cryptogram, it states that:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(10+T)\times(10+N)=200+10T+T"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"where "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"T"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"N"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are between 0 and 9. Now we can expand, simplify and factorise to get all the Ts and Ns together:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"100+10T+10N+TN=200+11T"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"TN-T+10N-10=90"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"T(N-1)+10(N-1)=90"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(T+10)(N-1)=90"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now we know that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"T+10"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"N-1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are two integers which multiply to give 90. These are all the pairs of factors which multiply to give 90: "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1,90"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2,45"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3,30"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"5,18"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"6,15"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"9,10"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"However, for a pair of factors to satisfy the cryptogram, one factor must equal "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"T+10"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" while the other must equal "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"N-1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", and since "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"T"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" lies between 0 and 9 a factor must therefore lie between 10 and 19. For instance, if we looked at the pair of factors "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(3,30)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"T"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" would have to equal either -7 or 20, neither of which would make sense in the cryptogram. An example of a pair that works is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(5,18)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", as "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"T"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" can equal 8 and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"N"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" can equal 6."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The only pairs containing a factor between 10 and 19 are:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"5,18"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"6,15"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So the answer is that there are only 2 possible solutions for "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"N"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We can check these; if we were to let "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"N-1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" equal the smaller number in the pair and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"T+10"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" equal the larger number, we would get"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"N=6"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"T=8"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" for the "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(5,18)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" pair, so the cryptogram would be"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"18\times16=288"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", or"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"N=7"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"T=5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" for the "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(6,15)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" pair, so the cryptogram would be"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"15\times17=255"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We can see that both of these solutions check out with the cryptogram in the question, and so there are 2 solutions."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: 1600 followers problem
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x^{2n} + a_{2n-1} (-1)^{2n-1} x^{2n-1} + \ldots + a_2 (-1)^2 x^2 + a_1 (-1)^1 x + a_ 0 "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Consider the polynomial above such that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" a_0 + a_1 + a_2 + \ldots + a_{2n-1} = 1600 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and it has non-negative integer roots "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"r_1, r_2, \ldots , r_{2n} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"For distinct prime "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"p_1,p_2, \ldots, p_{2n} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", compute the number of factors of the integer which has the form"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" p_1 ^{r_1} \times p_2 ^{r_2} \times \cdots \times p_{2n} ^{r_{2n}}. "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"heading","attrs":[{"level":6}],"content":[{"type":"text","text":"This problem is original. Follow me for more :)"}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"heading","attrs":[{"level":1}],"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Total no. Of factors of no. Are (1+r1)(1+r2).......(1+r2n)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"heading","attrs":[{"level":1}],"content":[{"type":"text","text":"P(x)=(x-r1)(x-r2)......(x-r2n)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"heading","attrs":[{"level":1}],"content":[{"type":"text","text":"P(-1)=(1+r1)(1+r2)....(1+r2n) as there are even terms all negatives become positive."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"heading","attrs":[{"level":1}],"content":[{"type":"text","text":"But P(-1)=1 + sum of coefficients if polynomial . Hence answer = 1+1600=   1601."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

                                            You must mention that it is the sum of "the absolute values" of coefficients.

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"
